msContents.summary: Two documents: request by Eulogios and his mother to have a certain property registered and report of proceedings from the diary of a strategos regarding the sale of the same property

msItem.note: Written along the fibers; on the back there is an account across the fibers
Some lines are faint and much of the text is lost: half of each col. is preserved; the protocol continued in another col
53 lines of writing: the main hand is chancery and is more stylized in the right col.; a second, clumsy hand (ll. 25-27) subscribes and a third hand writes quickly the first line
The papyrus moves back to August 6 315 the date of the first appearance in papyri of the praeses Aurelius Antonios

provenance.p: Purchased by Columbia University from M. Nahman through H.I. Bell, in 1924; no. 81 (box XIVb) in Bell

keywords.term: Aurelius Apollonios a.k.a. Eudaimon, -- strategos of the Oxyrhynchite

div.ab: Tenth pagus, vineland. In the fourth consulate of our lords Constantinus and Licinius Augusti to -- and to -- exegetes, both councillors of the illustrious and most illustrious city of Oxyrhynchos and keepers of the archives of landed property, from . . . of the village of Sesphtha in the tenth pagus and from her son . . . because of deceit and scheming from . . . NN of the village of Tuchinphagon . . . of the most distinguished governor . . . and thus we obtained his subscription . . . being evident he does not fail to recognize . . . he will provide the following . . . The defendants the appointed . . . the district
